page.title: 03Farming
page.content: All 4 farms keep cattle.Church Farm with 200 mainly Jersey cows in their milking herd produces 500 gallons of milk per day.D-K's herd is maintained at 160 milking cows and 80 heifers. Downley's herd of 62 Hereford and Aberdeen-Angus are reared for beef (and unusually pastured outside all winter) while Manor Farm's pedigree herd of Limousin cattle is being used in embryo implant experiments.This involves transferring the Limousin embryos into the wombs of Jersey or Friesian stock, thus hoping to obtain pedigree Limousin calves from non-pedigree mothers.This process is still in its infancy on this farm and success in the 1985 programme is hoped to offset the disappointing results of the previous year.The temperature of the womb and environmental conditions are of the utmost importance.
